angle.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees
angle.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
the angle between walls and ceiling
angle.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a way of considering a problem or situation
angle.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: We’re approaching the issue from many different angles.
Look at every angle of the situation.
There’s another angle to this question.
angle.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a position from which you look at something or photograph it
angle.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: This drawing of the monastery was done from an unusual angle.
Some of the pictures have strange camera angles.
angle.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the shape formed when two lines or surfaces join
angle.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: My head struck the angle of the shelf.
angle.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to move or place something so that it is not straight or upright
angle.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a mirror angled to reflect light from a window
Philip angled his chair towards the door.
angle.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to present information from a particular point of view or for a specific group of people
angle.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The book is angled towards a business audience.
